Why Work at Lifted Logic?


At Lifted Logic, we believe in creating exceptional work for our clients. We don’t cut corners, and we don’t slack. But in the end, when clients make back their money and we have a well-designed product to show off, it’s worth it.


We work in a highly collaborative environment—designers, writers, marketing professionals, developers, and project managers all work in one room. That means better communication, better end results—oh, and no one misses out on free popcorn or a beer pong break.

Our Candidate Experience
 
We Hire in a Five-Step Process
 
We believe in hiring the best digital marketing talent in the world. We give our candidates every opportunity to get to know us, just as we want to get to know them. Our five-step interview process includes:
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Initial Communication by the People Operations Team
 
You will be introduced to the company by one of our high-powered recruiters at Thrive, who will have several communication exchanges with you to make initial assessments that determine if you’re a fit for the role.
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Invitation To Meet Founder & CEO Matt Bowman
 
This is a key step in the process and is where you will join a Zoom call and be introduced to Thrive Founder and President Matt Bowman as he does a live slide presentation taking you through the history of Thrive. There is also a Q/A at the end of this presentation to ask Matt any questions you have.
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Invitation to the Group Interview
 
You will join a group interview. This is what makes our interview process stand out. You will join other candidates who have been invited to interview for the same position (typically between 4-6 candidates) and meet the Thrive leadership team as they bring you through a series of questions that are done in a round-robin format so that every candidate has the opportunity to answer the same questions. At the end of the two-hour group interview, we will open it up again for you to ask the leadership team any questions you may have.
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Skills and Culture Fit Assessment
 
After the group interview, we will narrow it down to the finalists who will move to round No. 2. Depending on the role, this round might include a project or a skills assessment. You will spend a one-on-one Zoom call with the department managers, where you will get to know the team leads and supervisors you will be working with.
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Decision and Offer (Welcome to your AMAZING future!)
 
After the finalists complete round No. 2, the team leads will deliberate and make a hiring decision. Collecting feedback from Thrive team members of varying levels of experience and perspectives is an integral part of how we work.

Thrive’s Significant Growth Over the Years
 
Our digital marketing agency has achieved significant milestones over the years. From only 62 digital marketing professionals in 2018, we now have 220 employees from around the globe working together to drive profitable business for our clients. And we continuously hire more specialists to become part of our growing family!
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Inc. 5000 Fastest-Growing Company 7 Years in a Row!
 
Thrive is proud to rank among the Inc. 5000 fastest-growing companies in the United States for seven consecutive years. Since the Inc. 5000 List started in 1982, only 1.5% of companies have made the list seven times! But our commitment to success doesn’t stop here. We continuously invest in our employees to ensure personal and operational excellence.
 
 
 
VIEW ALL OUR AWARDS
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
A Spirit of Collaboration
 
As a global company, we enjoy meeting Thrivers from across the globe and celebrating many cultural traditions together. Every year, we host a Thrive Camp where Thrivers convene in North Texas – or virtually online during the pandemic – to celebrate our achievements and amplify the joy of our work relationship.
 
Thrive Camp is an annual convention where we:
 
 
Celebrate team wins and reflect on our milestones
 
Discuss department updates
 
Attend life skill sessions
 
Participate in team-building exercises
 
Engage in community service projects
 
Recognize exemplary employees
 
Map out goals and strategies for the year ahead
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Steadfast Commitment to Community Growth
 
 
 
At Thrive, supporting local communities is an essential part of our business. As part of our Thrive Gives Back project, we partner with different organizations, such as Kiva, World Vision and Restore Hope, to donate a percentage of our profit and help enrich the lives of those who could use our help.
 
We are open to employee suggestions about what organizations and causes to support. More importantly, we encourage all Thrivers to devote volunteer time in service to their local communities.

Welcome to Opti9






Our team brings passion, intelligence, and grit to everything we do, and we make it fun. We are committed to building relationships, driving innovation, and contributing to our communities.


We are growing quickly and we want smart, driven people who care about the work they do to join our talented team of developers, engineers, and strategists.


Opti9 experts are recognized as some of the best in their field. Each individual’s skill set contributes to the mission of Opti9 and we believe business comes before technology. Are you ready to lead?


















Our Benefits












Unlimited

“You” Time






No matter how much you love your work, everyone needs a little PTO, so here at Opti9, we decided to offer that and MUCH more. Yep, it’s unlimited!


















Money

Matters






We offer market competitive compensation and a 401k plan to help save for retirement.


















Fido

Friendly






Opti9 offices are pet-friendly because an 8-hour day goes by so much quicker when your best friend is by your side.


















Wellness for the

Whole Employee






It’s hard to work when you’re sick or stressed, so at Opti9 we put health at the top of the list. Opti9 offers medical, dental, and vision plans for you and your family. We also offer an HSA and a Healthy Rewards program to keep our employees happy and healthy.


















Flexibility

& Results-Driven






While we love our offices in Omaha, Kansas City, and St. Louis, we (like everyone else) work just as happily from home. What matters most is we let our employees do their best work where they see fit.


















Snack

Attack!






Our offices are packed with snacks, a variety of drink choices, and even beer. Whenever you get a little hangry, the Opti9 pantry has you covered.

Job Description:
Capitol Tech Solutions is looking to onboard a local Sacramento WordPress Web Developer for a fast-growing Digital Agency.
You will be a member of our user experience team, with a focus on WordPress website development and implementation, focus on technical coding solutions and maintain the development playbook, documenting best practices according to W3C and WCAG compliance.
Primary Responsibilities:
As a WordPress Lead, you will be focused on quality of work, technical creativity, adherence to technical standards, and completing all of the development tasks that result in high quality websites. You will also be responsible for learning and implementing best coding practices and must show the ability to implement code changes with perfection.
Responsibilities:
Help build, maintain, and grow the Capitol Tech Solutions digital portfolio as a technical lead on the digital team
Create websites using HTML/CSS /Javascript /PHP in a WordPress environment
Integrate with 3rd party APIs and write new custom plugins, themes and web services to help streamline development team efforts and create scalable and easily manageable solutions for our home services business
Provide technical leadership to a team of 2 - 3 WP developers.
Ensure quality code and solutions are delivered by development squads by helping to architect scalable best-practice solutions, selecting and testing plugins, ensuring quality code commenting and documentation processes are followed AND completing code reviews prior to QA and UAT testing.
Assist the Director of User Experience in proposing and implementing process improvement initiatives to increase output, maintain quality and improve profitability.
Qualifications:
Effectively communication, via face to face, email and project management tools, Asana and MS Office 365 apps.
Ability to manage multiple work-streams and simultaneous projects in support of a growing portfolio of sites.
Experience working with a small high-functioning team of Digital Experts.
Strong attention to detail, who “get the big picture”, success in this role will depend most on your ability to dig into the details and create high quality technical solutions that align with business goals.
Proven experience on follow through. As a member of the Digital team, you’ll work within our project-based environment, where we’ll count on you to schedule and deliver work while providing oversight to team members.
Experience:
5+ years of professional front-end development experience using WordPress, Divi preferred
Strong experience in HTML5, CSS3, SASS, JavaScript, JSON and Wordpress (ACF, WPForms, custom post types and taxonomies) and PHP
Experience delivering fully responsive “mobile first” websites. AMP knowledge and development experience preferred.

Who We Are
Are you ready to suit up?


We intentionally hire a broad set of personalities, and we want everyone to be their genuine, authentic self. We’re looking for passionate people that are interested in a wide variety of stuff beyond work (we know you're already interested in work, that's the whole point).


We really don’t mind 
what
 you’re interested in, we mind that you're interested. Maybe you’re into gardening. Yep, we talk spring planting schedules. Discontinued TV shows from the ’80s, we’re deep into them. Chicken wings, beer, air fryers, we have the recipes you want. Darin has a 
VERY
 strong obsession with KISS. We have Slack groups for sports fans AND for people that don’t like sports. We run the gamut. We’re just looking to support each Titan’s wild and wacky interests. If you’re into something, we want to hear it. Chances are, someone is into it too.


We like to say "
We take our work seriously but refuse to take ourselves seriously.
" But we DO expect everyone to demonstrate POTIS every day, in their own way. It's how we hold ourselves and our fellow Titans accountable. What's POTIS you say?


P.O.T.I.S.


There are 5 traits every Titan must possess, in their own authentic fashion.



Why work at Irish Titan?




A Pretty Killer Office

Seriously, TitanHQ (aka the mothership) is fabulous, especially if you like green. You like green, right?




Insurance and Retirement

Medical, disability, life, 401k,  All that normal stuff you need to live. We’ve got you covered. (Covered. Get it? Whatever.)




Flexible Schedule

We like to treat people like adults who earn the right to be treated like adults. 
Actually
 flexible. Demonstrate POTIS, and you earn some flexibility.




We Take Lunch Seriously

Food truck Thursdays, recipe dedicated Slack channels, lunch trains, and next-level birthday treats; It’s all a big deal here. Our lunch game is strong.




Coffee, La Croix, and Beer

Free coffee? Tick. Free La Croix? Tick. (Pop too, we don’t judge) Free beer (wine, whiskey, etc)? Tick (but usually later in the day). Remember...we're Irish Titan, not 
Amish Titan
 (no offense, they're great bowlers).




Pet-First Environment

Though we have yet to see a cat (there’s still time), we have our dogs here just about every day. Not a cat/dog/llama lover? We have safe rooms for that.




Sit/Stand Desks

Sit or stand. Your desk, your choice. No forms to fill. No applications to complete. No questions to answer. We haven't seen Darin sit at his desk in years.




Field Trips & Company Parties

Get out of here! Seriously leave. From time to time we just encourage everyone to get out of the office and go have some management approved, officially sanctioned fun. Boxing. Puzzle Rooms. Massages. Fun is good. We like fun. We even have a mandatory, month-long sabbatical after 5 years. Hows that for making you leave.




The Batpole

The quickest way downstairs and the longest way back up. It can be done. We've seen it done twice. We even have a Batpole waiver form. Again, not a typo, there is a two story batpole in our office.




Recognition and Swag

Company kudos, 
real
 recognition for your work, team-focused attitudes, and managers that works for you. Give your coworkers tha kudos they deserve. We’re not unique here, just good at celebrating. New Titans also get a ton of swag. You like green, right?


Our Team Structure


We're the sum of our parts. Plus a little more.




SALES
 Making the wheels of industry turn and keeping us all in our jobs (Their words).


MARKETING
 
Actually
 write the words, plan the events, and even make all our newsletter links green. Attract, convert, delight. All that.


ACCOUNT MANAGEMENT
 Our "relationship whisperers". Remember; partnerships, not transactions.


PROJECT MANAGEMENT
 Orchestrating and delivering all of our B1O2 experiences.


PERFORMANCE MARKETING
 Data-driven geniuses (citation needed) charting a client's course to digital domination.


CREATIVE (UI, UX)
 Experts in design, content, form and function...and coffee. It's a creative thing.


FRONTEND DEV
 At the coalface, laying the groundwork for success. Don't tell Backend we said that.


BACKEND DEV
 At the coalface, laying the ground work for success. Don't tell Frontend we said that.


OPERATIONS
 "Everything" seems a little broad, but it's not far off the mark.

Whether you’re coming to us as a software engineer, a project manager, a business development leader, or something else, we’re excited to learn more about you.

                    Web Project Manager                    






The Web Project Manager oversees the project life cycle of website projects, as well as managing the prioritization and delivery of day-to-day website tasks. The Web Project Manager will manage multiple priorities while maintaining the standards of service excellence.






Apply Here
















Why You’ll Love Working Here






At Back40 Design, you’ll enjoy a casual, flexible and relaxed work environment with some added benefits: medical, dental, life insurance and Simple IRA. 


On top of that, here are our top 3 reasons you’ll enjoy being a part of the team: 


Variety


Our clients are local, regional and national companies that range from established brands to startups. And, we create custom solutions for every one of them – from a basic business card to a full branding project, or a brochure website to a complex web application, and more. Whatever their problem. We solve it.


Stability


We’ve been around since 2000, creating lasting relationships with our clients and our community. That’s 20 years of dedicated web and design services that you can count on.


Community


Our office is located on Covell in Edmond. We’re within walking distance from Uptown Grocery, Pie Five, Roxy’s Ice Cream, All About Cha, Pepperoni Grill and the Garage. As a member of our team, you’re encouraged to get involved in local professional development groups, meet-ups and conferences. As a company, we are very active with the Chamber of Commerce and support local nonprofits.


If you enjoy working alongside dependable self-managing professionals – this is the place for you. Contact us at 
careers@back40design.com
.

Amazing work. Amazing to work with.


We focus on providing outstanding work to our clients and taking exceptional care of each other. Here are a few of the ways we do just that. 


 


Work/life balance. Seriously.


We work hard during business hours (M-Th 7a-5p and F 7a-11a...yes, every Friday is a half-day!) and go home at the close of business hours. Rarely, if ever, do we find ourselves staying late or working weekends. Working smarter has its perks!






Shape a future you can be proud of.


We want every person at Speak to play a part in shaping our future. Your ideas matter, and we believe that each person brings something uniquely creative and important to the table. If there's an issue, we tackle it together. If there's an idea, we develop it together. We meet regularly for fun and creative team building.






What makes Speak such a great place to work?


We are balanced. We focus on people first - our team and our clients. We work hard toward creating movement for our clients and getting the job done, right on time and on budget. Not only that, but we genuinely call each other friends, and value learning and personal growth on the job.






Leadership rooted in faith.


Speak's owner CEO Jacob Savage brings the values of his faith in Jesus into his leadership of the company. That means that he strives to lead with humility, grace, and kindness, and to put people before profits. That also means that people of all backgrounds and beliefs are welcome here. 














Join our team


Let's do great things together.

        Why work at Speak?
      







        Grow Here
        








We care about your professional and personal growth. We offer a defined growth path process and plenty of ways to learn and grow in your role, from an entire website dedicated to internal training for all positions to funding and hours set aside for professional development and learning. 











        Technology-Driven
        








We have in-house developers, a partnership with Google, and a commitment to learning, training, and teaching to push ourselves further every year.











        Sustainable
        








Our client roster covers all industries and cities, and range from small to large.











        Leadership
        








We have leaders who care about the growth and success of those they lead and show it.











        Great working environments
        








We have a remote-optional policy that lets you work wherever you work best. If that's in an office setting, we have vibrant, fun offices in Memphis and Nashville designed to be collaborative spaces to work hard and play hard.











        Financially Sound
        








Speak has a long track record of profitability and is debt-free. Plus, the company owned by one individual, so we don't worry about partners who split.

We are seeking an experienced Senior Data Engineer to join our team. The ideal candidate will be responsible for designing, implementing, and managing data infrastructure and pipelines. You will work with a variety of data technologies to ensure our data is reliable, accessible, and secure.


Experience and Skill Sets Required:




Proficiency in working with data streaming platforms like Kafka.

Proven ability to build and maintain data pipelines.




Responsibilities:




Design and maintain data pipelines to ensure the availability and accuracy of data.


Collaborate with data scientists and analysts to understand data requirements.


Implement best practices for data quality, security, and scalability.


Optimize and troubleshoot data infrastructure.

Working at Avail






Avail Technologies is a leading innovator for the public transit industry. We believe this is not just a place to work, but a place to grow, learn, live and explore. Headquartered in State College, Pennsylvania, Avail believes in promoting a Fun, Enjoyable Workplace that encourages individuals to be more than just employees. We are looking for imaginative, ambitious people who want to join a growing team.


Avail is an ESOP organization, which means each employee is also an owner with a vested interest in the success of the company. Employee owners of Avail Technologies enjoy:


The Fun, Enjoyable Workplace Crew (F.E.W. Crew) at Avail organizes and sponsors events for employees and their families. Some of these events include an off-site Christmas party, various cook-offs (think chili, wings, soup, even a brew-off for the home brewer types) and more. A flexible, relaxed work environment allows many of our employees to enjoy daytime mountain bike rides or a stroll on one of the many trails that surround the Avail office. We want our employees to work hard–and play hard.

We found the cure for WVS (White Van Syndrome)! The doctors name is Dan Antonelli!  The prescription was a complete overhaul for our 54 year old business (Tuck & Howell).  It all started when I spoke to a friend of mine that hired Kickcharge to brand his business (Bullseye in Sarasota, FL.).  He recommended that I read the book Branded Not Blanded.  I was actually working for a company and had been telling my wife that I want to go out on my own....  I have been in the business my whole life and wanted to start my own business but I was missing something.  The book made it all come together for me.  The proverbial light bulb went off in my head the moment I read the book.  I had an opportunity to buy my family's business and it was right after reading Dan's book.The reason I keep referencing the book is because when a contractor thinks about a complete overhaul of their brand, they think "oh my gosh that's way too expensive".  The fact of the matter is that it's a hell of a lot more expensive not to do it!  That's the absolute facts!An amazing phenomenon about rebranding is that not only do you get to increase revenue by attracting more customers but you will attract potential employees!  YES I SAID THAT!  There is a huge shortage in this industry for technicians and installers as everyone knows.  The fact of the matter is that technicians like to feel proud of the company they work for.  They like to pull up to the house driving a wrapped vehicle with some cool and sticky branding, walk up to the door wearing a uniform matching the vehicle, handing the home owner a business card that matches as well!  These guys don't like driving a clunker, wearing a t-shirt with clip art on the left chest, and handing them a card that they designed on vistaprint!Ask for Erica and Gina as your project managers!  They are absolute Rockstars!  Very responsive, knowledgeable and professional!  Going through a rebrand there is a lot of communication and having someone that stays on top of things is extremely important not only for detail but timing.  These 2 gals are some of the best I have ever seen!  I don't know where they found them but they are lucky to have them!Get with the program!  Read the Branded Not Blanded Book, and more importantly #GETKICKCHARGED!
